Wagner Labor ArchiveElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2630tamiment.wagner@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2018-05-29T20:18:04Describing Archives: A Content Standard
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Dan Georgakas Papers on Motion Pictures TAM 411
1 Linear Feet (1 box)
undated Dan Georgakas is an anarchist,labor historian, scholar of Greek-American redicalism, and of motion pictures. Coauthor of Detroit: I Do Mind Dying and coeditor of the Encyclopedia of the American Left and he is a long time member of the Cineaste editorial board, and has taught part time at New York University and Queens College. The collection contains correspondence, manuscripts and subject files, most pertaining to Latin American cinema and his work for Cineaste. 1
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this gift is 1950.270.
Historical/Biographical Note
Dan Georgakas is an anarchist,labor historian, scholar of Greek-American redicalism, and of motion pictures. Coauthor of Detroit: I Do Mind Dying and coeditor of the Encyclopedia of the American Left and he is a long time member of the Cineaste editorial board, and has taught part time at New York University and Queens College.
Scope and Contents
The collection contains correspondence, manuscripts and subject files, most pertaining to Latin American cinema and his work for Cineaste.
Conditions Governing Use
Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 120 years.
